results.title: Algiers
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, Walter Wanger and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A romantic Casbah thief (Charles Boyer) makes the mistake of falling in love. Hollywood romantic drama based closely on the French original, Pepe le Moko. laughed at for years because of the alleged line `Come with me to the Casbah’ (which was never actually said), it holds up remarkably well in its fashion. Rated: PG

results.title: The Horse thief
results.creator_credit: Tian Zhuangzhuang and Xi'an Film Studio
results.brief_description: Horse Thief is a magnificent saga of survival, filmed on location in Tibet by one of China’s most innovative young directors. The film incorporates images of many of Tibet’s great Buddhist ceremonies and festivals; traditions that were almost eradicated in the “Cultural Revolution”, but which are now again observed as they have been for hundreds of years. The film neither endorses nor attacks Buddhist philosophy, but it does offer the most respectful view of Tibetan culture yet seen in Han Chinese art. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: The Old well = Lao ching
results.creator_credit: X'ian Film Studio Productions and Wu Tianming
results.brief_description: In an arid village in the Taihang mountains of Shanxi province the villagers have been digging unsuccessfully for water for many years. The village’s first college graduate tries to bring scientific rationality to their search for water. Zhiang Yimou, the director of “Red Sorghum” and cinematographer of “Yellow Earth”, plays the graduate. In contrast to Zhiang’s celebration of peasant earthiness in Red Sorghum, Wu, as in his earlier “Uncharted River”, brings a more realistic warts-and-all perspective to the portrayal of the Chinese people. As head of the Xi’an Studio, Wu was a key figure in the emergence of the ‘Fifth Generation’ of Chinese filmmakers. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Anne Devlin
results.creator_credit: Pat Murphy, Tom Hayes, Arts Council of Great Britain, Irish Film Board, Bord Scannan na Heireann and Aeon Films
results.brief_description: From farmer’s daughter to political prisoner, Anne Devlin has remained on the periphery of formal history - hers is a history of kitchen and children, fetching and carrying, the quiet heroism of a woman who recovers and buries the dead, who withstands protracted torture. She speaks through the ‘lost’ diaries she kept while in prison. This is the second feature of Irishwoman Pat Murphy and the first all-Irish feature. Cast includes Brid Brennan and Bosco Hogan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pat Murphy, Tom Hayes, Arts Council of Great Britain, Irish Film Board, Bord Scannan na Heireann and Aeon Films

results.title: To Sleep so as to Dream
results.brief_description: To Sleep so as to Dream is the first film by Japanese director Kaizo Hayashi and it’s a knockout. Sometime in the late 50’s, an ageing actress from the silent film era hires a detective to rescue her kidnapped daughter. What she is really searching for is her lost youth and the unknown outcome of her first film, `Eternal Mystery’. It was never completed because of a puritanical backlash against women playing women’s roles. Moving back and forth between the 20’s and 50’s, from silent to sound, this is one of the most original films in years: a detective story with a really satisfying ending.

results.title: Cabaret
results.creator_credit: Bob Fosse, Cy Feuer, Allied Artists Pictures and ABC Pictures (US)
results.brief_description: One of the most acclaimed Broadway musicals of all time is brought to the screen with the aid of the brilliant and electrifying Liza Minnelli. For entertainment as its very best you can’t go past “Cabaret” - a scintillating musical with pure gold of human drama beneath its surface glitter. A one-of-a kind musical. Based on Christopher Isherwood’s Berlin stories.

results.title: The Mission
results.creator_credit: Roland Joffe, Fernando Ghia and David Puttnam
results.brief_description: A man of the sword. A man of the cloth. A clash of civilisations. A fight to the death. A political parable and portrait of 18th century missionary works. Shot on location in the breathtaking jungles of South America, “The Mission” is a movie experience to be shared by all. Stars Robert de Niro and Jeremy Irons.

results.title: Gone with the wind
results.creator_credit: Victor Fleming, David O. Selznick, Selznick International and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This landmark film, based on Margaret Mitchell’s mammoth novel, won eight Academy Awards. The siege of Atlanta and the hardships of the South during the Civil War are masterfully unfolded in this terrific spectacle. Vivien Leigh’s performance as the headstrong Scarlett O’Hara is magical, and Clark Gable makes the ladies’ hearts flutter as Rhett Butler. Supported by Olivia de Havilland and Leslie Howard, the stars make this part spectacle, part history an epic entertainment.

results.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
results.brief_description: James Stewart stars as naive young Jefferson Smith, the well-loved head of a chain of boys’ clubs, who is unwittingly set up by a group of unscrupulous politicians and sent to Washington as a Senator. He is expected to vote as the party machine dictates and so ease the passage of a fraudulent Bill. Jeff discovers the double-deal and the normally mild mannered good guy turns into a veritable “house on fire” to attack the web of corruption that surrounds him.

results.title: The Day of the Triffids
results.brief_description: The few who retain their eyesight are horrified to see the Triffids normally small plants - grow to huge proportions as they become affected by the presence of the mysterious meteorites. As the Triffids multiply by the millions, they begin a march on civilisation, brutally destroying everyone in their path. Based on the book by John Wyndham. Rated: PG
